oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The First Package from Home

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Labels
World War, 1939-1945 -- Europe; Prisoners of war; Diaries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This item, a shipping or mailing label, has been taped in Mitchener's diary. It indicates that a package was sent to Mitchener from his mother, Estelle F. Mitchener, of Nashville, Tennessee. The label has a stamp from a U. S. Censor. In his diary Mitchener has noted, "The First Package from Home."

Mitchener was shot down and captured as a POW after a bombing mission in Germany and sent to Stalag Luft III in Sagan, Germany, now a part of Poland. Mail for prisoners was greatly delayed, as it had to pass through American censors. Mitchener's mother, Estelle Mitchener, was living in Nashville, Tennessee, when she sent her son a package of unknown contents. Estelle, who died in 1967, lived longer than her son, who died in America in 1957. Mitchener's father also outlived him, and died in 1964.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mitchener, Hardy A., 1919-1957
